fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An editorial on treasure laws referred to a “rare Roman cavalry helmet discovered a decade ago in a field in the Lake District”. The field is in the Cumbrian village of Crosby Garrett, within the Yorkshire Dales national park (11 December, page 2, Journal). • Tuesday’s Country diary was said to be from Buxton, Norfolk, when it was in fact from Buxton, Derbyshire (15 December, page 9, Journal). • Other recently amended articles include: Brexit: what will change on 1 January 2021 for people in UK? Swedish PM says officials misjudged power of Covid resurgence In a nutshell: how the macadamia became a ‘vulnerable’ species
